summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons TRUINTEL Supervisor Rounds log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, covering rounds conducted on August 9 and August 10, 2019. It documents routine security checks by lieutenants in various housing units, including the Special Housing Unit (SHU), during the days immediately preceding Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Supervisor Rounds at MCC
events.description: Lieutenants conducted multiple security rounds in various housing units (CUS, SHU, REC) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center throughout the day and evening.

events.title: Supervisor Rounds at MCC
events.description: Lieutenants conducted multiple security rounds in various housing units (CUS, SHU, REC, SUICIDE RM) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center throughout the morning, day, and evening.

keyFacts: The log documents prison supervisor rounds on August 9 and 10, 2019, the two days immediately before Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell on August 10, 2019.
Rounds were conducted in key areas including the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and a location explicitly labeled 'SUICIDE RM' (Suicide Room).
All rounds were logged as being conducted by lieutenants and marked 'Yes' for completion, indicating standard procedure was followed.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case files.
The log shows frequent checks, including during the 'Morning watch' (early morning hours) on August 10th.
